Questions.questionText: Which of three persuasive strategies does the author rely on most heavily in this text?

answers.feedBack: That is not correct. Although the author maintains his credibility by treating his subject fairly — adopting a neutral tone and avoiding any obvious bias — it is not the primary tool used to persuade the reader.
That is correct! The author appeals primarily to the reader’s sense of logic as he persuades us to view Facebook as a media company that has a responsibility to follow accepted editorial standards.

That is not correct. There is a noticeable lack of emotion in this text. By contrast, a more emotional appeal might have attempted to frighten the reader by imagining a future in which Facebook uses its power like a tyrant to control free speech online.
